lead_paragraph: HARNETT--Ruth. Age 91, passed away peacefully at her home in Boca Raton, Florida on January 10, 2016. She was predeceased on October 1, 2015 by her loving husband of 71 years, Bertram, a lawyer and retired New York State Supreme Court Judge. She is survived by her children, Andrea, a lawyer and retired Magistrate Judge in Washington, DC and her husband, Benjamin Fisherow; David, a psychiatrist in Medford, Massachusetts and his wife, Dr. Vivian Halfin; James, a lawyer in Madison, Wisconsin and his wife, Marsha Harnett; six grandchildren; and one great granddaughter. Ruth Harnett grew up in Far Rockaway, New York, and graduated from Brooklyn College. She later resided in Great Neck, New York, and in Manhattan. She served as the Director of the Nassau County, New York, Vocational Center for Women in the 1970's. She had many talents: she was an accomplished cook, a talented knitter and quilter, and a speaker of Italian. She read and travelled extensively. She was a beautiful, gentle, generous, elegant, and kind woman, beloved by all who knew her. Most of all, she was intensely loyal to her family, whom she loved as immensely, as we loved her. We will miss her greatly. A funeral was held on January 13, at Temple Beth-el in Boca Raton, Florida. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Planned Parenthood or to the charity of your choice. 1/3
